Articles.Content:
It would be cool to play with m&m's just like all astronauts experiencing 0g for the first time. It's almost a tradition. I think that the kermans
should have that same kind of humour and do things with no apparent reasons...

I know. My English sucks

10 hours ago, MrWalrus123 said:

can you explain?

I think it's meant to be a reference to that one film where they discover a face on Mars. Was it called 'The Red Planet', or sth?

I don't think M&M's should be in the game as they are kind of pointless, but think about this way: experiments (in widgets form) in 0G. We would be able to poke objects around and see how they bounce in the interior and stuff like that. They wouldn't even have to be 3D. Simple, Powder Toy-like widget with a bunch of materials available to mix.

5 minutes ago, Veeltch said:

I think it's meant to be a reference to that one film where they discover a face on Mars. Was it called 'The Red Planet', or sth?

Nope, that was Mission To Mars. Red Planet was about astronauts finding algae on the surface of Mars and running away from autonomous robot that turned against them.

Also even if there was breathable atmosphere, there still was -60 degree anyway though

Edited June 26, 2016 by The Aziz
